content: Consumption Model” on page 516  “Conclusion” on page 519  “IBM Z Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resiliency” on page 520  “Use cases of IBM Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resiliency” on page 520  “How does IBM Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resiliency work?” on page 521  “Tailored fit pricing for hardware and IBM Z Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resiliency” on page 525  “Ordering and installing IBM Z Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resilience” on page 526  “Terms and conditions of IBM Z Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resiliency” on page 527  “IBM Z Flexible Capacity for Cyber Resilience versus Capacity Back Up” on page 528 D 514 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide Tailored Fit Pricing IBM Z platform users were used to paying for IBM Z software and hardware for peak capacity and managing their software costs by capping machine usage. Traditionally, they capped machine use by using the following methods:  Running batch workloads during off-shift hours  Reducing machine resources access to development
